text:
October 31, 1962
Mr, Maurice Seay
W. K. Kellogg Foundation ^
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Maurice:
Enclosed are three copies of our financial statement reflecting
expenditures for our Headquarters operation, and the relation there¬
to of the support received from the W. K. Kellogg Foundation, for
the fiscal year 1961-1962,
I am also enclosing three copies of our gnnual program report,
which you will notice has an improved format and Includes reports
from our committee chairmen.
I am sorry for the delay in submitting these reports to you,
but, as Harold Hill explained to you on the phone several weeks ago,
we changed our time of reporting this year from July to the time of
the annual convention. Thus, the program report was prepared for
presentation to the members last week in Philadelphia.
Again, may X express our sincere appreciation for the support
the V. K. Kellogg Foundation has given us over the past eleven years.
I believe evidence that your initial faith in providing for our first
permanent office and staff is to be found in the fact that our Net¬
work operation has been completely self-supporting for the past seven
years and the Headquarters operation this year achieved a little better
than 70% self-support.
We also appreciate your personal Interest and friendliness over
the years and we hope that we may continue to call on you for counsel.
Sincerely yours.
WGH:pw
Enclosures
William G. Harley
